results.title: Matthew Flinders
results.brief_description:
This film recounts the story of Flinders and Bass’ journey to Australia and describes their discoveries of Australian coastlines and Tasmania, all of which was to be recorded in a book written back in England by Flinders himself.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Matthew Flinders
results.brief_description:
A depiction of Matthew Flinders and his wife arriving at a shack and meeting Aboriginals. After what seems to be an attack by an Aboriginal on a white person, Flinders kills the Aboriginal and he and his wife set sail.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Matter waves
results.creator_credit: Bell Telephone Laboratories, Educational Services and John Friedman
results.brief_description: A modern version of the original experiment showing the wave behaviour of the electron diffraction patterns on a fluorescent screen, making the patterns understandable in terms of wave behaviour by presenting an optical analogue showing almost identical patterns. Describes the electron diffraction experiments of Sir George Thompson and presents brief evidence for the wave behaviour of other particles, such as neutrons and helium atoms.

results.title: Matter of taste
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society, James B. Maas and David H. Gluck Productions, James B. Maas, Naomi Robin and David H. Gluck
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human senses”.
Looks at the important role played by taste in the human body. Investigates the chemical reactions in papillae and how information is obtained and relayed to the brain and the taste identified as sweet, sour,salty or bitter.

results.title: Matter of life and death
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and Trevor Lunn
results.brief_description: Alan Grossbard, an education officer with the State Electricity Commission in Victoria, talks about some of the features of electricity and the potentially dangerous results if it is misused.

results.title: Matter of heart
results.brief_description: This is an inspiring portrait of Carl Gustav Jung, a man whose genius and humanity caused his voice to reach far beyond the exclusive realm of psychiatry into redefining the essential nature of who we are and what we hope to become. More than just a linear biography, this program presents a fuller perspective of this healer, using rare home movies, archival footage, and a wealth of interviews.

results.title: Matter into energy (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Explains nuclear fission and fusion in terms of converting mass into energy according to Einstein’s E=MC squared formula. Employs both animation and live photography.

results.title: Matter and energy
results.brief_description: The film presents the concept that everything in the universe may be reduced to matter and energy. Matter in its different forms is presented, elements, compounds and mixtures are defined, and the laws of conservation of matter and energy are stated. The film ends with a brief discussion on atomic energy.

results.title: Matt Mann and his swimming techniques
results.brief_description: The various techniques developed in USA by matt Mann for teaching groups pf boys to swim are demonstrated. The crawl, the backstroke, breast stoke, and butterfly, are separately illustrated, from the beginning land drills to the completed stroke in the water.

results.title: Matt Mann's swimming techniques for girls
results.brief_description: A demonstration of Matt Mann’s teaching principles applied to a group of girls. The crawl, breast stroke, back stroke, and butterfly stroke are demonstrated in both regular and slow motion photography.
